reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Engaging and timely!
reviews.reviewText: Excellent book! Actually, all 4 in the series were excellent. All the major characters (and a few of the minor ones) were expertly fleshed out and I found myself caring for a lot of them (the heroes) and sad that I will not be able to read any more about them. The author obviously painstakingly researched this era and location in order to create an authentic narrative which was engaging, informative for the reader and (sadly) parallels some of the troubles that afflict the same region today. I felt like I learned a lot about this important and complex period and feel more sympathy for the same area today.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This book is methodical in taking you from start to finish the beginning of the issues for Jerusalem and the cry for assistance and what utimately happened in the time period referenced. This is written more in play form style but was easy to follow along with. It is a gripping story for anyone who is interested in this topic. I enjoyed it again it is not my normal genre but I would read it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars historical fiction- best way to learn
reviews.reviewText: The characters are so well developed that you feel for them, hope for them; in some cases you hate them, in others you love them! I especially appreciate the variety of main characters-peaceful Jewish believers, extremists, sympathetic non-Jews, those in the ruling classes, soldiers, etc. It allowed me to see of point of view from many sides.The layout of the temple and the region is so well done, making the story easier to follow. There is so much happening and the author makes it easy to imagine. While I may want to know history, non-fiction formats don't work well for me; books like this make it come alive and stick in the brain!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seriously, don’t judge a book by its cover.
reviews.reviewText: I really did not know what to expect with this book. But it is a period in history that I find interesting, so I gave it a shot. When I started I thought it might be a dry history book, but it is fascinating. The characters come to life and the setting is vivid. Such a pleasant surprise. A really good read. I’m a little bummed I can’t find anything else by Sanford. Hopefully this won’t be the last thing he writes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Same as book 2. Great read. Highly recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Great read! Really enjoyed the characters and the historical time line. Can’t wait for the next one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I thought it was interesting and good. I liked it a lot. It’s a long book. I was given an arc and I choose to give an honest review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent and engaging!
A Look Into the First Century
reviews.reviewText: Cry For Jerusalem is a thorough look at the chaotic era leading up to the fall of Jerusalem. Well-researched and described as if the author had personal experience in the time and places. He paints the settings in great detail, making it easy to picture the action. This detail does slow the story, but this is not a quick light read, but rather a look at the powers and influences at play while told in the context of a fiction story. In the genre of historical fiction, it leans heavier on the "historical" than the "fiction".Character development was spot on. I appreciated the growth that was discernable in several of the main players.I'm looking forward to the second book.
